result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Bergemann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Concurrent with: Any existing period of probation.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any further violent and/or confrontational contact with Christine B. Ogden.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L. Bergemann

Case Called @ 10:52 AM: Defendant Robert L. Bergemann in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint recommendation on resolutio recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 w/Repeater:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.  Statement by Def:   Yes apologizes to the Court.   The Court: Accepts Joint recommendation - 10 mos WCJ - I/S (Huber and GT) 5 days TS credit - S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended,  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; No further argumentative and/or confrontational contact with C. Ogden; Costs plus DNA surcharge;  DNA sample to be provided today.  Expungement process of DNA record thru DOJ explained to Def.  Court Costs plus Surcharge.  Appeal Rights Given.  Concurrent terms on supervision with existing.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Robert L. Bergemann in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter has been resolved-requests P/S date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 10:45 am.

1:11 pm case called. Defendant Robert L. Bergemann in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Robert L. Bergemann in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 09:10 am.
